ext_description.p: A Draughting_title is a brief text describing the contents of the drawing or drawing sheet. It is draughting application-specific, language-dependent, and may be applicable to more than one drawing or drawing sheet.
ext_description.example: A drawing containing the mechanical compatibility information for a safety switching device may be given a text description such as "MECHANICAL COMPATIBILITY, SAFETY SWITCH", where the language is English.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The revision_identifier and drawing_identifier shall be unique within a population of the Drawings.

ext_description.p: A Drawing_definition is an identification and categorization, by type, of a set of drawing versions.
ext_description.note: When the need for a drawing is identified, a drawing definition begins its existence when the organization assigns a drawing number.

ext_description.p: specifies a number of the drawing for the Drawing_definition.

note.p: Drawing numbers themselves are often composed of parts such as: a type prefix, a part number (or stem), and a suffix. Its composition is provided by the originating organization.

example.p: "CK123456-789", "DL-S12345", "1B5102-04", and "1D55500" are examples of drawing number strings.

ext_description.p: a string used to describe the functional categorization of the drawing.
ext_description.note: A type of drawing is used to communicate a specific portion of the information about a product. For a printed wiring assembly, the functional aspects are communicated by means of a schematic diagram whereas the physical aspects are communicated by means of another drawing type.
ext_description.example: "SCHEMATIC DIAGRAM", "SITE PLAN", "DETAIL", and "ASSEMBLY" are examples of drawing-type labels. Additional examples for drawing-type labels may be found in clause 3 of ISO 10209-1.
ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.
